definition: clapper-board/auctioneer's hammer/to beat time with clappers
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
see 老闆|老板, boss
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: The positions of the holes can be converted or more holes are arranged on a racket board in an anamorphic embodiment.
sentences.chinese: 在变形的实施例中可在拍板上变换孔的位置或多设孔。

sentences.english: Allegedly, this plan is Chi Yufeng be made personally and of clappers.
sentences.chinese: 据说，这一次的计划就是池宇峰亲自制定并拍板的。

sentences.english: Goering was hoping to strike a bargain with the Allies.
sentences.chinese: 戈林正设法同盟国拍板成交。

sentences.english: Many farmers use clappers to stop birds eating the crops.
sentences.chinese: 许多农民用拍板来吓走吃庄稼的鸟。

definition: to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to come to a decision/to fix on (a date etc)/to determine/to finalize/to nail down (a deal etc)
to give a nod of approval
to consult/to talk over/to discuss
lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
see 作主[zuo4 zhu3]
to make a decision/to determine
to ask for instructions
to have the final say/to be the one in charge
to negotiate/discussion/proposal
full powers/total authority/plenipotentiary powers
first decapitate then present your trophy (idiom); act first, report later
to agree (to do sth)/to promise
to make a decision/resolution/decisiveness/resolute
to veto/to overrule
to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
